title: Rabbit Stew
directions: Using half the flour coat the pieces of rabbit, shaking off any excess.
Heat the oil and butter in a large heavy-bottomed saucepan, and brown the floured rabbit on all sides.
Separately fry the onion and garlic.
Add the fried onions, celery, parsnip, carrots, salt, pepper, herbs, water and red wine, and stew for about 1.5 hours.
Add the potatoes 1h into the stewing process.
Once the rabbit and all the vegetables are cooked, use some water from the stew to form a paste with the remaining flour.
Stir the flour mixture into the pot as a thickener.
Add the already sauteed mushrooms to the stew and allow to simmer for about 10 minutes.
Adjust seasonings, if necessary, and serve.
ingredients: 1 kg rabbit, cut into stew sized pieces
